data.question: What is the main application of coordination polymer networks (CPNs) mentioned in the text?
What is the CO2 adsorption capacity of SNU-M10 at 195 K and 1 atm?
Which material shows a higher CO2/N2 selectivity at 298 K and 1 atm, SNU-M10 or SNU-M11?
True or False: The CO2 adsorption isotherms of SNU-M10 and SNU-M11 do not exhibit gate-opening phenomena.
What is the role of the quadrupole moment of CO2 in the adsorption process?
data.answer: It induces interaction with the networks to open up the channels.

data.question: True or False: SNU-M11 adsorbs CO2 gas at 273 K and 298 K up to 1 atm.
What is the gate-opening pressure of SNU-M10 at 298 K?
Which material has a higher flexibility of pillars, SNU-M10 or SNU-M11?
True or False: The networks of SNU-M10 and SNU-M11 are not thermally stable up to 300 8C.
What is the effect of the quadrupole moment of CO2 on the network structure at 298 K and 1 atm?
data.answer: Expansion of the network on CO2 adsorption

data.question: True or False: SNU-M10 and SNU-M11 have the same CO2 adsorption capacity at 195 K and 1 atm.
What is the main challenge in the selective capture of CO2 from industrial emission streams?
data.answer: The presence of other gases such as N2, CH4, and H2O

data.question: True or False: The CO2/N2 selectivity of SNU-M10 at 298 K and 1 atm is lower than 24:1 (v/v).
What is the main strategy used to construct highly flexible 3D coordination polymer networks for CO2 capture?
data.answer: Using 2D grids formed from square-planar NiII macrocyclic complexes and connecting them with highly flexible alkyl pillars

data.question: True or False: The CO2 adsorption capacity of SNU-M10 at 298 K and 1 atm is higher than 10 wt %.
What is the CO2 uptake of SNU-M11 at 298 K and 23 bar?
True or False: The networks of SNU-M10 and SNU-M11 are not air- and water-stable.
What is the significance of the gate-opening energy (DHgo) of SNU-M10 for CO2 uptake?
data.answer: It indicates the energy required for structural transformation of the network from the closed phase to the open phase.

data.question: True or False: The CO2 adsorption isotherms of SNU-M10 and SNU-M11 do not show large hysteretic desorption.
What is the main advantage of using highly flexible 3D coordination polymer networks for CO2 capture?
data.answer: Their ability to selectively capture CO2 over other gases due to the flexibility of the network structure
